item.title: Best EA Games That Lived Up To The Hype
item.description:
Electronic Arts has enjoyed an interesting trajectory in the video game industry. Despite being the most hated company in video gaming at one point, EA has worked to improve its reputation over time, even if it occasionally stumbles.

No matter what people may say, the hype machine is always strong for some of the most celebrated video games around. Players loved that these titles fulfilled their promise and became some of the best games made under EA's watchful gaze.

8 Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order

A Stellar Star Wars Title That Felt Great To Play, Especially Once The Glitches Were Patched Out

3 Images
3 Images
Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order
9 /10
Released
November 11, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Fallen Order is one of the best Star Wars games players can get their hands on. Fans wondered whether Respawn would be adept enough to develop a third-person game after their work on the Titanfall games and Apex Legends , but there was always the belief that this studio would do something special.

Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order didn't disappoint, allowing players to experience Cal Kestis's journey as he became a powerful Jedi. Using the Force to take out Stormtroopers and other enemies makes for a great time and helps this game stand out as one of EA's best.

7 Dragon Age: Origins

An Ambitious BioWare Title That More Than Lived Up To The Hype

Dragon Age: Origins
9 /10
17
9.1 /10
Released
November 3, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content
Powered by

Dragon Age: Origins is one of the best Western RPGs ever made, which kickstarted the collaboration between EA and BioWare on a high note. This ambitious role-playing game was off the charts and did a great job of introducing players to this amazing dark fantasy IP.

Based on the player's choice of race, they could start with one of six unique origins before they become a Grey Warden. The plotline takes a wild turn with several twists and turns, making this adventure even more of a blast.

6 The Sims 3

The Open-World Elements Of This Game Were In A Class Of Their Own

The Sims 3
8.5 /10
Released
June 2, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Crude Humor, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

The Sims 3 is easily the best game in the series, mainly because of its execution of an open world. The life sim gameplay was a blast to interact with and ensured that players would get invested in this game for hours upon hours.

The expansion packs ensured that players can interact with a bunch of gameplay loops and enjoy what this magical title has to offer. While it had some performance issues, this was a small problem in the grand scheme of things since fans fell in love with the improvements of The Sims 3 , lamenting that this open world wasn't carried over to The Sims 4 .

5 Battlefield 1

Generated A Ton Of Hype With Its World War 1 Setting And Delivered On It In Spades

5 Images
5 Images
Battlefield 1
9 /10
10
8.4 /10
Released
October 21, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Battlefield 1 's hype was through the roof, especially after fans had a negative reaction to Infinite Warfare 's reveal. The return to a historical war setting did wonders for Battlefield 1 , which became one of the biggest successes in the series.

The gameplay in both the single-player and multiplayer campaigns was a blast and ensured that players could engage in long, spectacular wars for hours on end. The amazing action and setting ensured that Battlefield 1 would leave a lasting impression on many fans.

4 Split Fiction

After It Takes Two, Fans Couldn't Wait To See What Else Hazelight Studios Had To Offer

7 Images
7 Images
Split Fiction
19
8.8 /10
Released
March 6, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood and Gore, Crude Humor, Language, Violence
Powered by

After the success of It Takes Two , fans expected the world from Hazelight Studios and their co-op offerings. Split Fiction promised to be a bigger and better version of Hazelight's breakout success, and it succeeded in every way.

The environments are gorgeous and the gameplay variety is off the charts, ensuring that fans would have a blast with this amazing title. The story may be the only negative point, but the co-op masterclass of Split Fiction ensures that it'll leave a lasting impression on players.

3 Dead Space 2

Players Were Excited To See What The Sequel To One Of The Best Horror Games Would Bring To The Table

Dead Space 2
8 /10
8.8 /10
Released
January 25, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Dead Space wowed everyone with its horrifying atmosphere, immersive UI elements, and unique combat. Despite a greater focus on action in Dead Space 2 , the game doesn't disappoint and is considered a worthy sequel in the eyes of many.

Isaac Clarke's character is expanded on as the games must deal with a bunch of necromorphs that can tear them apart. While Dead Space 3 may not have lived up to the series and its quality levels, the first two games are masterclasses in action horror that fans must play if they want to get immersed in an unnerving sci-fi experience.

2 Crysis

The Visuals Generated Hype, And The Gameplay Kept Fans Entertained

6 Images
6 Images
Crysis
8.0 /10
Released
November 13, 2007

ESRB
M
Powered by

Crysis wowed everyone with its incredible visuals, making it a major talking point before its release. PC players wanted to test their systems with this title, and it helped that the game itself was a blast to play.

Using the Nanosuit powers, sneaking up on enemies, and grabbing them to show dominance made Crysis one of the best FPS games that fans will have a great time with. Players looking for a fun FPS to mess around with will have a blast with Crysis and its simple, beautiful offerings that still look great.

1 Mass Effect 2

One Of The Greatest Sequels Ever Made That Satisfied Many Fans

Mass Effect 2
8 /10
11
9.1 /10
Released
January 26, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Mass Effect was a promising first step for this new IP, but the title still had its fair share of issues. Not only were most of these problems rectified in Mass Effect 2 , but the game's heightened stakes ensured that players would embark on the adventure of a lifetime.

Commander Shepard is reconstructed after an explosive opening and amasses a group of operatives who work with Cerberus to tackle the threat of the Reapers. The combat is action-packed, the story is riveting, and the final set-piece is as iconic as they come, with fans embarking on a Suicide Mission to stop the Collectors.

item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong - Grand Gate Map Location
item.description:
After conquering the Blasted Steps and defeating the Last Judge, Hornet pushes into the next stage of her journey in Hollow Knight: Silksong the Grand Gate. This monumental structure marks the transition into the Choral Chambers and is the entry point to Act II. Having the Grand Gate map early on is great for orienting yourself within the Citadels layered pathways, benches, and hidden challenges.

Track your progress through Pharloom using our Hollow Knight: Silksong map!

Where to Find the Grand Gate Map in Hollow Knight: Silksong

Unlike most earlier areas where you had to track down Shakra to buy your maps, the Grand Gate offers an immediate purchase. Once the Last Judge is defeated, your path leads directly into the Grand Gate. From the site of the battle, continue moving to the right until you reach a pressure-sensitive platform.

Standing on this platform opens a door to the right, and stepping through brings you face-to-face with the towering gate itself. Just inside, you will find a machine displaying a model of the Citadel that can be inspected. This is your chance to purchase the Grand Gate Map for 40 Rosaries. The process is simple: interact with the machine, insert the Rosaries, and the map is yours.

What to Do After Buying the Grand Gate Map in Hollow Knight: Silksong

With the Grand Gate Map in hand, you can now safely push deeper into the Citadel. Continue moving right after purchasing it, and youll soon come across an elevator. Activating the switch drops the lift downwards, carrying Hornet into the depths. The descent is dramatic, it jolts a couple of times and requires you to hit the switch repeatedly. Eventually, the elevator breaks, causing Hornet to fall into the Underworks. The Underworks is a dangerous mechanical area below the Citadel.

When the elevator crashes, you can walk to the right and spend 15 Rosaries to raise a bench. Take the opportunity to rest here, but remember that these benches are only temporary. Youll need to pay 15 Rosaries each time you want to use them. Once youve recovered, keep moving right to exit the Grand Gate and enter the Underworks.

In the Underworks, you will eventually find a new area called The Cauldron, where you can unlock a new ability: the Clawline. The Clawline is a grappling hook-like power that is an absolute must-have for exploring the rest of the game and accessing new shortcuts.

The journey through the Grand Gate and into the Underworks officially marks the beginning of the second act and is a major turning point in Hornet's quest to reach the top of Pharloom.

item.title: How Long Is Silksong? (& How Many Silksong Acts Are There?)
item.description:
It's no surprise that Hollow Knight: Silksong is often compared to a hard game like those of the soulslike genre, considering how tough and unforgiving some parts of the game are. At first, players will explore the world calmly, as they start in a lush, green area, with only harmless caterpillars and flying bugs as their foes. However, this will soon change, especially if players decide to enter Hunter's March, one of the hardest early game regions, thanks to its hand-numbing pogo challenge and two tough boss fights that block the way to progress in the area.

Thankfully, some biomes in Silksong are not part of the main story, meaning they can be skipped if players don't wish to explore them. If you're wondering how long it takes to beat Silksong and how many acts there are , this article will provide an overview of both questions.

How Many Acts Are There In Silksong?

There are two main Acts and a secret Act 3 in Hollow Knight: Silksong . So, if you wish to fully experience the game, you will be playing 3 Acts in Silksong .

Here are the three Acts in Silksong :

  • Act 1 : Pharloom
  • Act 2 : Citadel of Song
  • Act 3 : Abyss

Act 1 begins when Hornet falls on Moss Grotto and will go on until she enters the Grand Gate of the Citadel. Meanwhile, Act 2 will continue until players defeat the Monarch of Pharloom. Finally, Act 3 ends when Hornet bests the Act 3 final boss.

Defeating the Monarch of Pharloom is considered beating the game for the Speedrunner achievement, regardless of whether players choose to continue to Act 3 or not. However, for a first playthrough, it's highly recommended to fully experience Hollow Knight: Silksong , meaning players should take the time to fulfill the requirements to reach Act 3.

Read here to learn about Act 1 progression in Silksong .

How Long Is Silksong?

There are two speedrunner achievements in Hollow Knight: Silksong :

Achievement

Requirement

Speedrunner

Complete the game in under 5 hours.

Speed Completion

Achieve 100% game completion and complete the game in under 30 hours.

Therefore, it's safe to say that, for a normal playthrough, a 100% completion will take far longer than 30 hours.

The time it'll take to beat Silksong will vary based on your experience, like:

  • Experience playing a Metroidvania game.
  • Platforming expertise.
  • Boss fight skills.

Here's an estimate of how long to beat Silksong , based on how much content is being played:

Amount of content

Veteran

Average

Beginner

Act 1 & Act 2 main story

10 hours

20 hours

25 hours

Main story, including Act 3

20 hours

30 hours

35 hours

Full Completionist

50 hours

60 hours

70 hours

item.title: Silksong: How to Get the Architect Crest
item.description:
Crests in Hollow Knight: Silksong can completely change Hornet 's playstyle, such as making her attacks deal higher or lower damage, but also changing the attack speed along with it. Some crests outperform others when it comes to combat, while others are great to have in difficult platforming sections. The Architect Crest unlocks during Act 2 and has a very unique ability, which costs Silk. This guide offers information on the location of the key that unlocks the Chapel where the Crest resides in Hollow Knight: Silksong .

How to Get the Architect Key in Silksong

After getting to the second act and leaving the Underworks to reach the Coral Chambers , you will need to find the White Key . This key gives you access to the elevator, which goes down into Whiteward and ultimately to the eastern section of Underworks, which is your destination. The White Key is located at the top right of the Citadel , inside the Songclave . Once you bring the key back and explore your way to reach the Underworks, you will come across a bench where you can hear an NPC talking.

Your goal is to reach this NPC, but you cant at the moment since you are missing an ability. Make your way left and then down to the bottom, where the lava is. Head right, and you will have to progress through this difficult platforming section to reach the central part of Eastern Underworks, where you can find the Clawline ability.

Head back up to the bench and jump up to find a grapple point you can harpoon and make your way to the NPCs room. Inside, you will find the Twelfth Architect who is selling several Tools, as well as the Architect Key for 110 Rosaries .

It is important to note that purchasing the key requires you to have a certain number of tools in your inventory. The number of tools you are missing will be displayed when you try to buy the key.

How to Get the Architect Crest in Silksong

With the key in your possession, head right of the NPC, and there should be a lever that you can hit to open the door . Head up and turn left to find a second lever that you can hit, which puts you in an area above the Twelfth Architect. Jump and dash to the left side, hit the third lever, and head through the passage to find a locked gate bearing the symbol of an Architect. Use the key to open it and head inside the Chapel of the Architect . Unlike other chapels, where you have to deal with a boss or multiple enemies, this chapel doesn't harbor any enemies. You can simply go over and claim the Architect Crest , which will require you to use your Bind .

The Architect Crest has 3 Red, 2 Blue, 2 Yellow, and 0 White slots. You can press up Circle/B on your controller to spend Silk and craft new tools. The normal and charged attacks for the Crest are also different, as they look like screws that can shred foes.

item.title: Best Top-Down Shooter Games With Great Stories
item.description:
Summary

  • Good stories in video games can shine through with top-down views and atmospheric storytelling.
  • Shooter games like RUINER demonstrate how narrative can enhance gameplay beyond reflexes.
  • Top-down shooters like Synthetik: Legion Rising can deliver cold, brutal narratives through ambiance and lore snippets.

Great video game stories are often associated with close-up over-the-shoulder camera angles or gritty first-person views, but that doesnt always have to be the case. Sometimes all it takes is a top-down view and a blood-streaked hallway.

Top-down shooters have long been known for testing reflexes and willpower with hordes of enemies, but nowadays, the genre hides more than just twitch-action. These games prove that good stories can stand on their own no matter what camera angle theyre told from; whether its through atmosphere, subtext, or full-blown narrative arcs.

RUINER

Brotherhood, Brain Hacking, and Bloody Streets

Ruiner
Arcade
Shooter
Systems
Released
September 26, 2017

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Reikon Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
Powered by

Taking place in the brutal cyberpunk city of Rengkok in the year 2091, RUINER mixes fast-paced twin-stick combat with a dystopian, bleak atmosphere. Players take control of a helmeted, voiceless protagonist on a mission to rescue their brother, who was kidnapped by a corporate regime.

The story is told through visuals, cryptic NPC dialogue, and a mysterious hacker who manipulates the players neural link. Themes of control, self-identity and rebellion against corporations make the game feel like an adrenaline-fueled lovechild of Akira and Blade Runner. RUINER s linear, tightly-paced narrative perfectly complements the games relentless high-speed combat.

Hotline Miami

Who Are You, Again?

Hotline Miami
9 /10
8.0 /10
Released
October 23, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Intense Violence, Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Strong Language, Crude Humor
Developer(s)
Dennaton Games
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, Android, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, PS Vita, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Hitting players like a truck right from the start, Hotline Miami doesnt bother with any sort of build-up. It drops players into a surreal, ultra-violent 1989 Miami as a nameless hitman receiving mysterious phone calls to massacre. The gameplay is brutally fast, emphasizing one-shots, trial-and-error, and mask powerups.

The games narrative is unassuming at first, quietly festering in the background until it boils over to the point of fourth-wall-shattering twists. The fragmented narrative structure blurs reality, making the player question their morality, purpose, and their very identity. The story of Hotline Miami is one that sinks in only after the blood dries, leaving a lasting sense of unease.

Alienation

Xenos, XPlosions, and Extinction-Level Stakes

Alienation
Shooter
Action RPG
Systems
Released
April 26, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Game Experience May Change During Online Play, Violence
Developer(s)
Housemarque
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4
Powered by

This little-known co-op focused twin-stick shooter from the PS4 era has players playing as a member of UNX, an elite task force battling an alien invasion that has wreaked havoc on Earth. The story follows humanitys final stand against the so-called Xenos, and the secrets hidden behind their sudden appearance.

Although its light on dialogue, the campaign unravels through mission briefings, logs, and events throughout the world that hint at hidden conspiracies. Alienation lets its worldbuilding do most of the talking, driving the narrative by way of level progression, enemy variety, and environmental storytelling.

Nex Machina

The Robot Rebellion You Didnt See Coming

Nex Machina
8.0 /10
Released
June 20, 2017

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Housemarque
Platform(s)
PS4, PC
Powered by

Developed in collaboration with one of the creators of Resogun, Nex Machina is a pure arcade-style shooter with deep mechanics and explosive pacing. The story isnt text-heavy; instead, its built almost entirely off of visual narrative, depicting a world where humans are being overrun by AI machines.

The games techno-dystopia is communicated through its neon-drenched aesthetic and thematic boss fights. Theres also everyones favorite mechanic of chasing and rescuing positively unintelligent human NPCs. Though its more subtle than other entries on the list, Nex Machina s narrative themes sneak in between the bullets.

Dead Nation

When The Apocalypse Is The Least Of Your Problems

Dead Nation
Shooter
Systems
8 /10
Released
November 30, 2010
ESRB
m

Developer(s)
Housemarque
Platform(s)
PS3, PS4, PS Vita
Powered by

Dead Nation looks like any other gritty zombie shooter on the surface, but dig a little deeper, and players will find a surprising amount of world-building hidden in its campaign. Players take control of one of two immune survivors in a zombie apocalypse, navigating city ruins, sewers and outposts.

The story builds by way of radio transmissions, NPC monologues, and environmental clues, leading to huge revelations about government secrets and military betrayal. What starts off as a straightforward zombie romp becomes a survival tale that leaves players questioning whos really in control with its oppressive atmosphere and slow-burn revelations.

Transcendence

Roguelike Enlightenment Across The Stars

  • Platforms : Linux, Microsoft Windows
  • Developer : Kronosaur Productions
  • Initial release date: November 28, 2003

An underrated top-down space shooter with roguelike elements, Transcendence is a sci-fi lovers paradise. Players pilot a customizable ship across procedurally generated star systems in a universe on the brink of war and religious conflict. Despite its minimalist visuals, its packed to the brim with world-building.

The story emerges through interactions with different factions, artificial intelligences, and mysterious alien relics, revealing philosophical themes about humanity, divinity, and evolution. Spanning lightyears to uncover competing ideologies and ancient technologies, Transcendence is a great example of how to do storytelling through exploration, not exposition.

The Ascent

Climb The Tower, Dismantle The System

The Ascent
7.0 /10
Released
July 29, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Neon Giant
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Taking place in a corporate-run arcology after a mega-corp mysteriously collapses, The Ascent has players taking control of an indentured worker whos forced to fight through gang wars, rogue AI, and power-hungry factions as the citys very infrastructure collapses around them.

The gritty sci-fi world is all the more fleshed out with fully voiced dialogue, side quests and branching NPC interactions. Pair that with the verticality, neon-flushed design, and themes of economic impression, and it perfectly mirrors Judge Dredd and Neuromancer in video game form. With a campaign that explores personal and systemic collapse, The Ascent balances action with smart, subversive storytelling.

Synthetik: Legion Rising

Machines Remember What We Forget

Synthetik: Legion Rising
Shooter
Indie Games
Systems
Released
March 15, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PS4, Xbox One, PC
Powered by

Being an elite android tasked with taking down the Machine-God before it erases what little is left of humankind sounds like a tall order. Fortunately, players can bring a friend along. Synthetik: Legion Rising is a futuristic top-down shooter where an AI army called the Machine Legion has turned against humanity.

Its a hardcore top-down shooter first, even having the option of two-player co-op. The games narrative stands out for its cold, brutal tone that mirrors the gameplay perfectly. Though its not straightforward with its storytelling, the lore snippets, enemy designs and ambiance do most of the heavy lifting in giving players the feeling of fighting in a world long abandoned by humanity.
